name: stata-workbench
description: Allows Stata code to be run directly from the IDE. Enables AI agents to directly interact with Stata, powered by mcp-stata.
author: Thomas Monk

stataMcp.requestTimeoutMs.description: Timeout (ms) for Stata metadata/UI requests (e.g., getting variable lists). To enable timeout for long-running execution commands (Run File, Run Selection), use stataMcp.enableExecuteTimeout.

stataMcp.enableExecuteTimeout.description: Enable timeout for Stata execution commands (Run File, Run Selection). If disabled, these commands will run indefinitely unless manually cancelled.

stataMcp.loadStataOnStartup.description: Load Stata automatically when VS Code starts. This makes the first run faster but consumes memory immediately.

stataMcp.autoRevealOutput.description: Automatically show the Stata output channel after runs.

stataMcp.showAllLogsInOutput.description: Stream all raw mcp-stata logs to the Stata Workbench Output channel.

stataMcp.logStataCode.description: Log the Stata code sent to the server in the Output channel (useful for debugging agentic commands).

stataMcp.autoConfigureMcp.description: Automatically add/update the mcp-stata server entry in your host MCP config (mcp.json). Disable if you manage MCP servers manually.

stataMcp.configureClaudeCode.description: Also configure Claude Code CLI MCP settings when installed. Writes to ~/.claude.json or project .mcp.json based on scope.

stataMcp.claudeCodeConfigScope.description: Where to configure Claude Code CLI MCP server: user (~/.claude.json) or project (.mcp.json at workspace root).

stataMcp.runFileWorkingDirectory.description: Working directory when running .do files. Supports an absolute path, ~, ${workspaceFolder} or ${fileDir}; empty uses the .do file's folder.

stataMcp.setupTimeoutSeconds.description: Timeout (seconds) for Stata initialization (stata_setup.config preflight). Passed to STATA_SETUP_TIMEOUT for mcp-stata.

stataMcp.maxOutputLines.description: Maximum lines of output to return from Stata commands (0 = unlimited). Useful for limiting token usage with verbose commands like regress or codebook.

stataMcp.runFileBehavior.description: Choose whether 'Run File' should run the current editor content (including unsaved changes) or the version saved on disk.

stataMcp.defaultVariableLimit.description: Default number of variables to select when opening the Data Browser (0 = all). Useful for huge datasets with thousands of variables.

stata-workbench.telemetry.enabled.description: Enable Sentry telemetry to help improve Stata Workbench. No personal data or Stata content is collected.

scripts.test:full: bun test --concurrent --preload ./test/bun-preload.js test/unit && bun run test:integration:parallel
scripts.vscode:prepublish: node -e "const t=process.env.npm_config_target || process.env.BUILD_TARGET; const s=process.env.SENTRY_UPLOAD; if(t) require('child_process').execSync('bun run download-uv ' + t, {stdio:'inherit'}); require('child_process').execSync('bun run bundle' + (t ? ' -- --target=' + t : ''), {stdio:'inherit', env: {...process.env, SENTRY_UPLOAD: s}});"
scripts.package: bun run bundle && node ./scripts/verify-build.js && bunx vsce package
scripts.package:target: bun run download-uv $npm_config_target && BUILD_TARGET=$npm_config_target bunx vsce package --target $npm_config_target
scripts.package:dist: bun run bundle && node ./scripts/verify-build.js && bun -e "require('fs').mkdirSync('dist',{recursive:true});" && bunx vsce package --out dist/stata-workbench-$(bun -e "console.log(require('./package.json').version)").vsix
scripts.package:local: SENTRY_UPLOAD=false bun run bundle && SENTRY_UPLOAD=false node ./scripts/verify-build.js && bun -e "require('fs').mkdirSync('dist',{recursive:true});" && SENTRY_UPLOAD=false bunx vsce package --out dist/stata-workbench-$(bun -e "console.log(require('./package.json').version)")-local.vsix
scripts.publish:ovsx: bun run bundle && bunx ovsx publish -p $OVSX_TOKEN

untrustedWorkspaces.description: MCP services require a trusted workspace.
